channel.title: Diakatana Beta
channel.description: has anyone heard of the game Daikatana? Its was release about a year before dues ex, by eidos. Now i was cleaning out my basement and i came across an old beta from 1997 that i still had, if anyone is interested in trying that beta, just let me know and ill torrent it for you

item.description:

But Levelord is better.

Modern day developers all look gay, which is sad.

Robotic frogs and giant metal mosquitoes will never help making a successful game.

item.title: Diakatana Beta
item.dc:creator: SwampFox56
item.description:
bigfan421:

@OP were/are any of your relatives former/current Eidos employees?
'Cause the fact that you have a Beta of a (crappy) game that’s well over a Decade old kind-sorta bugs the crap out of me.

my dad used to work for a company based in nebraska, called nebraska furniture mart, and he always got invited to E3, and all of the big game show, he said that he also would acculy go to (lets say nintendo) nintendo’s warehouse and pick up nintendo 64’s. Now that was back in the 90’s so that wuz a long time, ago. He actuly got his hands on one of valves early betas of Half-Life 1 (before the used the goldsrc engine, and were still using the quake 2 engine) which is probably in my basement with all the other decade old software

JamesKane:

I remember playing it after all the anticipation :fffuuu:

ya i remember that too, and i the second i played it i wuz like, “what the hell is this crap?”

and acutely i remember this beta being better than the full version

Read full topic

item.title: Diakatana Beta
item.dc:creator: JamesKane
item.description:
loony636:

How big is it? I never tried the original, but it might be a good look at home the game was/should have been.

IIRC, Daikatana was mostly horrible because of lengthy delays; it was based on horribly outdated technology by the time it was eventually released, which meant it look tired and old.

I remember playing it after all the anticipation :fffuuu:

Read full topic
